info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:58AM CDT until August 01 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY COUNTY... At 258 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Buda to near Elmira to Wataga, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kewanee, Galva, Bishop Hill, Nekoma, Kewanee Municipal Airport, Ulah, German Corner and Johnson-Sauk Trail State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
